perturbation.original_text: The undersigned understands and agrees that as to          ----------------                                                     GSMS he is an "affiliate" under Rule 145(c) as defined in Rule 405 of the Rules and Regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended ("1933 Act"), and the undersigned anticipates that he will be such an "affiliate" at the time of the Merger.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned understands that as to GSMS he may or may not be considered an "affiliate" under Rule 145(c) as defined in Rule 405 of the Rules and Regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended ("1933 Act"), depending on the interpretation of his relationship with the company post-merger. The determination of affiliate status will be at the sole discretion of PSS legal counsel.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by making affiliate status uncertain and dependent on PSS's interpretation, conflicting with the initial statement of understanding and agreement. This creates ambiguity and potential disputes regarding the affiliate's obligations and restrictions under the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: The undersigned understands that PSS is under no                         ------------------------------------------------    obligation to file a registration statement with the SEC covering the    ---------------------------------------------------------------------    disposition of the undersigned's shares of PSS Common    -----------------------------------------------------
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned understands that PSS may, at its sole discretion and business needs, file a registration statement with the SEC covering the disposition of the undersigned's shares of PSS Common.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'is under no obligation to file' to 'may, at its sole discretion... file', we introduce a contradiction regarding PSS's responsibility for facilitating the affiliate's ability to sell shares. This could create uncertainty about whether PSS will take actions to allow the affiliate to easily dispose of their stock.

perturbation.original_text: PSS agrees, for a period of three years          ------------------------                                           after the effective date of the Merger, to file on a timely basis all reports required to be filed by it pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, so that the public information provisions of Rule 145(d) promulgated by the SEC as the same are presently in effect will be available to the undersigned in the event the undersigned desires to transfer any shares of PSS Common Stock issued to the undersigned pursuant to the Merger.
perturbation.changed_text: PSS intends, but is not obligated, for a period of three years after the effective date of the Merger, to use reasonable efforts to file all reports required to be filed by it pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, so that the public information provisions of Rule 145(d) promulgated by the SEC as the same are presently in effect will be available to the undersigned in the event the undersigned desires to transfer any shares of PSS Common Stock issued to the undersigned pursuant to the Merger. However, PSS's failure to file such reports will not be considered a breach of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction by stating PSS 'agrees' to file reports, then undermining that agreement by saying they are only intending to use 'reasonable efforts' and that failure to file is not a breach. This introduces ambiguity and weakens the affiliate's reliance on PSS fulfilling this obligation.
